title: First pictures of 'doomsday cult' dad who 'kept kids in cellar for nine years

These are the first pictures of the dad who allegedly kept his children locked in a cellar for nine years as part of a doomsday cult.

Grey-haired Gerrit Jan van Dorsten, 67, posted bizarre videos on social media, showing him using a homemade rowing machine and stretching in the garden.

The dad and his supposed pal 'Josef the Austrian' have been arrested for holding his six adult children captive at a farmhouse in Ruinerwold, the Netherlands, reports say.

It is claimed the pair met through the Unification Church, a South Korea-based cult also known as the 'Moonies'.

(Image: Facebook)

(Image: Facebook)

Van Dorsten and his children were found in the farmhouse after his eldest son drank five beers at a nearby bar and revealed his ordeal to the owner.

The father used the name John Eagles on Facebook, with his posts ranging from commentary on North Korean agriculture to videos showing his 'off-grid' lifestyle.

His profile included ramblings about near-death experiences, men using cosmetics and whether NASA planned to build a farm on Mars, Mail Online reports.

(Image: Facebook)

(Image: Facebook)

In a post accompany his homemade rowing machine video, the father said: "The rowing machine is finished. It works very well and gives a good workout for many parts of the body. This is now part of my daily exercise routine."

Pictures on his page include snaps of his cats lying in the sun and a shot of him practising Tai Chi.

In the latter post he wrote: "Pardon my not looking so clean. The sandy knees are from work in the garden and I have three dogs that like to jump on me with their dirty feet."

(Image: Facebook)

(Image: Facebook)

Other posts include pictures of various exercises and his musings about the hardships faced by North Koreans.

His profile states he studied philosophy, music history and psychology.

Police said his children emerged from the Dutch farmhouse communicating in a 'fantasy language' - and parts of their speech were completely incomprehensible.

Officers added that the victims slept and ate on the floor of their windowless prison.
description: Gerrit Jan van Dorsten, 67, posted bizarre ramblings about North Korea and a clip of him using a homemade rowing machine on Facebook
